title: Quality Control Inspection for Thickness Variation
steps: Measure thickness at minimum 5 points across the width using calibrated micrometer
Record measurements at center, quarter points, and edges
Calculate average thickness and compare to specification tolerance
If variation exceeds ±0.1mm, mark material for review
Document all measurements in quality log
Notify production supervisor if out of tolerance

title: Surface Finish Inspection
steps: Clean surface with appropriate solvent
Use surface roughness tester at multiple locations
Measure Ra (arithmetic average roughness) value
Compare against specification (typically Ra ≤ 0.4μm for food grade)
Document measurements
Reject if surface finish does not meet requirements

title: Chemical Composition Verification
steps: Obtain sample from production batch
Prepare sample for spectroscopy analysis
Perform XRF or OES analysis
Verify chromium, nickel, and other alloying elements
Compare results to grade specification
Document and archive test results
tolerance: Must meet grade specification within standard ranges

title: Handling Scrap Material
steps: Separate scrap by steel grade to prevent contamination
Measure and record scrap quantity
Assess scrap quality and reusability
Store reusable scrap in designated area by grade
Dispose of non-reusable scrap according to environmental regulations
Update inventory system with scrap quantities

title: Safety Guidelines for Hot Rolling Operations
steps: Ensure all personnel wear appropriate PPE (heat-resistant gloves, face shields)
Verify equipment safety interlocks are functional
Check material temperature before handling
Maintain safe distance from hot material (minimum 2 meters)
Use proper lifting equipment for hot material
Report any safety incidents immediately
